Leonard TanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Feb 2019Statements as such have imbued logical fallacies in them, known as "connecting the dots backwards". Its very easy to look back and claim you saw it all coming, but its not often the case. There are more than 1000s of IPOs worldwide yearly- of which less than a 1% have made it big to FAANG levels. If u search online, there are plenty of articles going along "if I have invested in $100 in apple/google/amazon/facebook when it IPOed, it would be worth more than ~100x multiples of that today." The truth is if you indeed bought a stock at say $100, you would have likely sold it even before it shot up to 10 or 20x multiples. Even if you did buy stocks for the long term(10 year horizon), chances are, investors would not have picked a winner close to success like FAANG.0 comments0
